page.title: 02Changes in Chudleigh
page.content: We interviewed Bob Taylor, a lifelong resident of Chudleigh who recalled some of the changes since his boyhood 55+ years ago. When he was a child visitors were taken to Chudleigh Rocks, a series of caves and stories were told about the place where ancient Britons lived. There used to be a stone wall around Ugbrooke Park which was an old Iron Age or Roman fort. Bishop Lacy was the last bishop of Exeter resident in Chudleigh who lived at the Bishop's Palace near Chudleigh Rocks at Palace Farm. When Bob was a child of 5 or 6 there were 6 slaughterhouses in Chudleigh where each butcher slaughtered his own animals.
